meanings.definition: Having two basic groups or functions.
meanings.sent1: The bibasic solution contained both acid and base properties.
meanings.sent2: The bibasic nature of the molecule allowed it to react with both acids and bases.
meanings.sent3: The bibasic compound was like a versatile tool in the chemistry lab.
meanings.sent4: Her bibasic personality made her both sweet and assertive.
meanings.sent5: The bibasic character in the story could adapt to any situation.

meanings.definition: Relating to a compound with two acidic hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent1: The bibasic acid required a specific reaction to neutralize both hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent2: The bibasic compound released two hydrogen ions when dissolved in water.
meanings.sent3: The bibasic substance was like a double trouble for the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her bibasic remarks hit like a double-edged sword.
meanings.sent5: The bibasic solution was as potent as a two-headed dragon.
